data.title: Charles Mann – The Essential Collection
data.text:
Description

Release Date: 1998

Label: Jin Records

Track List

1 Keep Your Arms Around Me

2 I’m Just A Wondering

3 Red Red Wine

4 Walk Of Life

5 My Life Is A Lonely One

6 She’s My Kind Of Girl

7 Don’t Tell Me, Tell My Heart

8 You’re No Longer Mine

9 She’s Walking Towards Me

10 Tomorrow Never Comes

11 From A Jack To A King

12 Mama Mama

13 Borderline

14 All That’s Left For Me Is Right

15 I’ve Got Dreams To Remember

16 Pretty Poison

Notes

Charles Louis Domingue was born Nov. 22, 1944 in Welsh, Louisiana. As a youngster he would sing along while listening to the radio and later in life joined the church choir. At 16 he joined a local band, Ricky and the Hound Dogs, singing rock & roll and South Louisiana Music, now known as Swamp Pop. Later, he joined the group, The Electradoors, from Gueydan, Louisiana. In 1965 their first single, “Keep Your Arms around Me,” was recorded and ‘Charles Mann’ was born. The single became a huge regional hit which was soon followed by several others. This Essential Collection is the first CD collection of hits by this legendary star.
